trigger_event: A new cache of sensitive information lands in Rada’s possession amid chaos: one set of records reveals brutal, neighborhood-level BCI scoring abuses; another offers mysterious, possibly forged Halden audio messages. Both could upend the city in different ways.
dilemma: Rada must decide whether to expose undeniable evidence of the BCI’s biased score punishment, risking explosive, targeted unrest—or broadcast the enigmatic Halden Echoes, stirring citywide suspicion and hope but fueling rumor and confusion.
reason: Rada knows either story will have dramatic, unpredictable fallout. Publishing the hard data could trigger harsh crackdowns and harm innocent neighborhoods; sharing the Halden Echoes could turn the city into a battleground of rumor and paranoia. Both choices exploit her unique access as a reporter on the edge, but threaten to push her—and Stenograd—past any point of return.
choice_a: Break the story with undeniable proof of BCI abuses, naming neighborhoods most harmed.
belief_a: Truth, no matter how painful, empowers people to demand change.
Reporting clear injustice is the only way to hold power accountable.
Shining light on algorithmic cruelty exposes the system’s moral bankruptcy.
choice_b: Broadcast the cryptic Halden Echoes, letting rumor and myth stoke rebellion instead of hard facts.
belief_b: Myths spark movements where facts are suppressed or dangerous.
An enigma can unify people against the system through hope and unease.
Letting legend speak invites citizens to interpret and resist in their own way.
